Dear Jackie,

Please find enclosed the quotation released by Liva (formerly RSA), sourced through Marsh Insurance Brokers.

Liva has an excellent reputation for overall service and claims processing. However, their quote is not competitive compared to our existing terms, and GIG remains the better option.

Liva is proposing a 4.5% premium rate, which is lower than GIG’s 5%. However, they are imposing a deductible of 20% compared to GIG’s 10%, in addition to a higher base deductible starting at AED 1,000, which increases based on banded values as outlined below:

Liva is proposing a 4.5% premium rate, which is lower than GIG’s 5%. However, they are imposing a deductible of 20% compared to GIG’s 10%, in addition to a higher base deductible starting at AED 1,000, which increases based on banded values as outlined below:

Insured Value (AED)
Excess	 
0 - 50,000
AED 1,000 + 20% of the repair cost
50,001 - 100,000	 AED 1,250 + 20% of the repair cost	 
100,001 - 250,000	 AED 1,450 + 20% of the repair cost
250,001 - 350,000	 AED 1,700 + 20% of the repair cost	 
350,001 - 500,000	 AED 2,000 + 20% of the repair cost	 
501,001 & Above	 To be referred to Underwriter prior to inclusion in fleet

Please note that this quotation was provided even after our existing terms were disclosed to the insurer.

I am also enclosing the quote submitted by Sukoon earlier this year, prior to the latest renewal. The terms are similar to GIG’s but with a slightly higher base deductible.

The existing insurer, GIG, remains the most competitive option.

I remain at your disposal should you require any further details.

Best Regards,
